channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A first-time HPV vaccination campaign sees some success -- and strong resistance
item.description: The goal: inoculate 90% of girls in parts of Pakistan to immunize them against the infection that causes cervical cancer. "Our biggest challenge was to counter misinformation," says a spokesman.
item.content:encoded:
The goal: inoculate 90% of girls in parts of Pakistan to immunize them against the infection that causes cervical cancer. "Our biggest challenge was to counter misinformation," says a spokesman.

(Image credit: Betsy Joles for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Text and photos by Betsy Joles

item.title: Fedora man unmasked: Meet the teen behind the Louvre mystery photo
item.description: "I didn't want to say immediately it was me," fifteen-year-old Pedro Elias Garzon Delvaux said. "With this photo there is a mystery, so you have to make it last."
item.content:encoded:
"I didn't want to say immediately it was me," fifteen-year-old Pedro Elias Garzon Delvaux said. "With this photo there is a mystery, so you have to make it last."

(Image credit: Thibault Camus)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Many would-be buyers are frozen out of the housing market
item.description: Only about one in five homes sold in the last year went to a first-time buyer. And the average person buying their first home was 40 years old — a record high. A new report from the National Association of Realtors shows how challenging it's become for young people to get a foothold in today's costly housing market.
item.content:encoded:
Only about one in five homes sold in the last year went to a first-time buyer. And the average person buying their first home was 40 years old — a record high. A new report from the National Association of Realtors shows how challenging it's become for young people to get a foothold in today's costly housing market.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Nearly a million people evacuate as Super Typhoon Fung-wong threatens the Philippines
item.description: Super Typhoon Fung-wong, the biggest storm to threaten the Philippines this year, started battering the country's northeastern coast ahead of landfall on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
Super Typhoon Fung-wong, the biggest storm to threaten the Philippines this year, started battering the country's northeastern coast ahead of landfall on Sunday.

(Image credit: Malacanang Presidential Communications Office)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Judge says Education Dept. partisan out-of-office emails violated First Amendment
item.description: A federal judge says the Trump administration "overplayed its hand" by inserting partisan language into workers' out-of-office autoreplies.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge says the Trump administration "overplayed its hand" by inserting partisan language into workers' out-of-office autoreplies.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Trump says boat crews are narco-terrorists. The truth is more nuanced, AP finds
item.description: In interviews in villages on Venezuela's northeastern coast, from which some of the boats departed, residents and relatives said the dead men had been running drugs but were not narco-terrorists.
item.content:encoded:
In interviews in villages on Venezuela's northeastern coast, from which some of the boats departed, residents and relatives said the dead men had been running drugs but were not narco-terrorists.

(Image credit: Peter Hamlin)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 4 dead, 11 injured after a car chased by police plows into a crowd outside Tampa bar
item.description: A deadly crash in Tampa's Ybor City neighborhood early Saturday morning has left four people dead and 11 injured.
item.content:encoded: A deadly crash in Tampa's Ybor City neighborhood early Saturday morning has left four people dead and 11 injured.
item.dc:creator: Ava Pukatch

item.title: After 40 years, plans to deploy a new undersea habitat are in progress
item.description: A British engineering and research company is unveiling a "subsea human habitat," a base that four people can live and work in for missions of a week or more. It's the first new underwater habitat developed since the 1980s.
item.content:encoded: A British engineering and research company is unveiling a "subsea human habitat," a base that four people can live and work in for missions of a week or more. It's the first new underwater habitat developed since the 1980s.
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: CRISPR gene-editing works to reduce high cholesterol in a new study
item.description: An experimental gene-editing treatment shows promise for permanently lowering levels of cholesterol and triglycerides, possibly helping cut the risk for heart disease.
item.content:encoded:
An experimental gene-editing treatment shows promise for permanently lowering levels of cholesterol and triglycerides, possibly helping cut the risk for heart disease.

(Image credit: TEK IMAGE/Science Photo Library)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: Doctor in Sudan wins $1 million prize for his extraordinary courage: 'It is my duty'
item.description: Dr. Jamal Eltaeb of Sudan has been awarded the Aurora Prize for Awakening Humanity. He says, "Every day we work in the impossible conditions with barely enough to keep people alive."
item.content:encoded:
Dr. Jamal Eltaeb of Sudan has been awarded the Aurora Prize for Awakening Humanity. He says, "Every day we work in the impossible conditions with barely enough to keep people alive."

(Image credit: Aurora Prize)
item.dc:creator: Arundathi Nair
